concept.title: Programming user-defined aggregates
concept.shortdesc: allows you to create custom aggregate operators, called user-defined aggregates (UDAs).

section.p: A UDA is a Java class that implements the org.apache.derby.agg.Aggregator interface.

The org.apache.derby.agg.Aggregator interface extends java.io.Serializable, so you must make sure that all of the state of your UDA is serializable. A UDA may be serialized to disk when it performs grouped aggregation over a large number of groups. That is, intermediate results may be serialized to disk for a query like the following:
section.codeblock: SELECT a, myAggregate( b ) FROM myTable GROUP BY a
section.p: The serialization will fail if the UDA contains non-serializable fields.
